item.description: If anyone is daring enough to dodge some potential raindrops with me Saturday morning, I have a dog that is desperately in need of some outdoors time, so rain or shine, we’re going to Bradley Palmer for a long walk...besides, there's a greater chance for SUN than rain!  We’ll start off along the river trail and then cross over to the meadows and back to the main road…probably estimate 3-4 miles.  If it’s really raining hard, we’ll skip the meadows and stick with the wooded trail along the river for some cover.  There are a couple short but steep sections along the river, otherwise it’s pretty level with periodic roots/branches/loose gravel to step over.  The meadows typically have a “stomped down” or mowed down path- but nonetheless- beware of ticks and check yourself well.  Bug spray is recommended- the mosquitoes have been kind of nasty. Please note the $1 meetup fee to help cover costs of Meetup dues.   I’m not very familiar yet with BP…still finding my way around- so once we get to the fields it’s a little bit of exploration/map reading…please be comfortable with learning the trails along with me J
item.how_to_find_us: Main parking lot- bear right twice as you come off Asbury Rd

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Last minute walk- Saturday morning at Bradley Palmer
